Package it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.infra.persistence

Class HibernateRepository<T,ID>

java.lang.Object
it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.infra.persistence.HibernateRepository<T,ID>
Type Parameters:
T - entity type we manage
ID - primary key type for that entity
All Implemented Interfaces:
CrudRepository<T,ID>
Direct Known Subclasses:
CategoryRepository, TransactionRepository
public class HibernateRepository<T,ID> extends Object implements CrudRepository<T,ID>
Generic repository backed by Hibernate that implements CrudRepository. It try to keep things small and boring: each call runs in a short unit-of-work via inTx(Function) so we dont repeat same boilerplate again and again. Error handling is minimal by design and sometimes feels rough on the edges.

Transactions

  • Start a tx, do the work, commit when ok.
  • On RuntimeException we rollback and rethrow it (no fancy wrap).
  • Sessions are created per call and always closed with try-with-resources.

Thread-safety: depends how you use it. A Session is never shared between calls, which is usually what you want underneeth.

  • Constructor Details

    • HibernateRepository

      public HibernateRepository(Class<T> type)
      Create a repository bound to a specific entity type. Not much magic: we store the class literal and use it for lookups and queries.
      Parameters:
      type - the entity class literal; if null, things will go wierd later

  • Method Details

    • inTx

      public <R> R inTx(Function<org.hibernate.Session,R> work)
      Run the provided unit of work inside a fresh Hibernate transaction. The session is opened and closed here; on success we commit, on failure we rollback and throw same exception up. Simple and do the job.
      Type Parameters:
      R - result type produced by the unit of work
      Parameters:
      work - lambda receiving the active Session and returning a result
      Returns:
      the value returned by work
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - anything your work throws will be rethrown here too

    • findById

      public Optional<T> findById(ID id)
      Get an entity by its id if present.
      Specified by:
      findById in interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
      Parameters:
      id - the primary key we are looking for
      Returns:
      Optional with entity when found; otherwise empty (no exceptions for missing)

    • save

      public T save(T entity)
      Persist (insert or update) the given entity using Session.merge(Object). The returned instance can be a managed copy; that is normal JPA/Hibernate behavior.
      Specified by:
      save in interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
      Parameters:
      entity - the entity to save; passing null is a bad idea and will explode
      Returns:
      the saved (maybe managed) instance

    • findAll

      public List<T> findAll()
      Return all entities of type T. Order is unspecified unless other place says otherwise (db/dialect may differ).
      Specified by:
      findAll in interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
      Returns:
      list of entities; never null, maybe empty if nothing are there

    • deleteById

      public void deleteById(ID id)
      Delete an entity by id, if it exist. If not found, this is basically a no-op, which is fine for most use cases so callers dont need to check before.
      Specified by:
      deleteById in interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
      Parameters:
      id - the primary key of entity to remove
